Hello and welcome to my website!
My name is João Granja-Correia and I am a PhD candidate at the Universidad de Cantabria, where I am researching project management and agile methodologies. Specifically, I am interested in the leadership skills that enable agile project managers to contribute to project successndefinednd
In addition to my research, I have been lecturing on project management at Nova SBE since 2012.
I am also passionate about R and R development, and I specialize in developing leadership skills assessment tools and personalized reporting using R and RMarkdown.

title: João Granja-Correia
text:
jgc672@alumnos.unican.es
  
  
    
     @joaocorreia@mastodon.world
  
  
    
     joaojcorreia
  
  
    
     0009-0003-8982-278X
  



I am a PhD candidate at the Universidad de Cantabria, where I am researching project management and agile methodologies. Specifically, I am interested in the leadership skills that enable agile project managers to contribute to project success, and how agile can be defined through the lens of paradox theory.
In addition to my research, I have been lecturing on project management in executive education programs at Nova SBE since 2012, where I am alse involved in the challenging school’s digital transformation process.
I am passionate about R and R development, and I specialize in developing leadership skills assessment tools and personalized reporting using R and RMarkdown.
My interests are:

Project management, both predictive and agile methodologies
Survey based quantitative empirical research
Reproducible automatic data-analysis and reporting with R

Outside of work, my time is mostly occupied by my three wonderful children, who keep me on my toes and bring joy to my life. I love spending time outdoors, and during the summer you can often find me at the beach, enjoying the sun, sea, and a good book. I am fluent in English, Portuguese, Italian and Spanish, and I’ve been trying to learn Hebrew for the past few years, although progress has been slow.
